chefs.chefDetail: Amina Ahmed is a renowned Bangladeshi chef with over 15 years of experience in cooking traditional Bangladeshi cuisine. She is known for her expertise in using locally sourced spices and ingredients to create delicious and authentic dishes.

recipes_list.name: Shorshe Ilish (Hilsa fish in mustard gravy)
recipes_list.cooking_method:
1. Marinate the fish pieces with turmeric and salt. 
2. Heat mustard oil in a pan and fry the fish pieces until golden brown. Keep aside. 
3. In the same oil, add the sliced onion and fry until golden brown. 
4. Add mustard paste, turmeric powder, red chili powder, and salt. Mix well. 
5. Add water and bring to a boil. 
6. Add the fried fish and slit green chilies. Cover and simmer for 10-12 minutes. 
7. Serve hot with steamed rice.

recipes_list.name: Bhuna Khichuri (Spicy rice and lentils)
recipes_list.cooking_method:
1. Wash the rice and lentils together and soak for 30 minutes. 
2. Heat oil in a pan and add chopped onion. Fry until golden brown. 
3. Add ginger-garlic paste and fry for a minute. 
4. Add chopped tomato and green chilies. Fry until the tomato is soft. 
5. Add cumin powder, coriander powder, turmeric powder, red chili powder, and salt. Mix well. 
6. Add the soaked rice and lentils. Stir well. 
7. Add enough water to cover the rice and lentils. Bring to a boil. 
8. Lower the heat and cover the pan. Cook until the rice and lentils are soft and the water has evaporated. 
9. Serve hot with a side of fried eggplant or potato.

chefs.chefDetail: Rahim Uddin is a passionate Bangladeshi chef with over 10 years of experience in creating delicious traditional dishes. He specializes in using local ingredients and spices to bring out the authentic flavors of Bangladeshi cuisine.

recipes_list.name: Biryani
ingredients: 1 lb chicken or lamb, cut into small pieces
recipes_list.cooking_method:
1. Wash the rice and soak for 30 minutes. 
2. Heat oil in a pan and add the whole spices (bay leaves, cardamom pods, cloves, cinnamon stick). Fry until fragrant. 
3. Add chopped onion and fry until golden brown. 
4. Add ginger-garlic paste and fry for a minute. 
5. Add chopped tomato and green chilies. Fry until the tomato is soft. 
6. Add cumin powder, coriander powder, turmeric powder, red chili powder, and salt. Mix well. 
7. Add the chicken or lamb pieces and fry until golden brown. 
8. Add water and bring to a boil. 
9. Add the soaked rice and stir well. 
10. Cover the pan and simmer for 10-15 minutes, or until the rice is cooked and the water has evaporated. 
11. Serve hot with raita or salad.

recipes_list.name: Chingri Malai Curry (Shrimp in coconut milk curry)
ingredients: 1 lb medium shrimp, deveined and cleaned
recipes_list.cooking_method:
1. Heat oil in a pan and add the whole spices (bay leaves, cardamom pods, cloves, cinnamon stick). Fry until fragrant. 
2. Add chopped onion and fry until golden brown. 
3. Add ginger-garlic paste and fry for a minute. 
4. Add cumin powder, coriander powder, turmeric powder, red chili powder, and salt.

chefs.chefDetail: Fatema Begum is a passionate chef who specializes in creating delectable Bangladeshi desserts. With over 10 years of experience in the culinary world, she has mastered the art of creating desserts that are not only delicious but also visually appealing.

recipes_list.name: Rasmalai (Cottage cheese dumplings in sweetened milk)
recipes_list.cooking_method:
1. Boil the milk in a heavy-bottomed pan. 
2. Add vinegar and stir until the milk curdles. 
3. Strain the curdled milk through a muslin cloth. Press out the excess water and hang for 30 minutes. 
4. Knead the cottage cheese until smooth. Make small balls and flatten slightly. 
5. Boil water and sugar in a large pot. Add the cottage cheese balls and simmer for 15-20 minutes. 
6. In another pan, heat the cream and cardamom powder. Add saffron and stir well. 
7. Add the sugar syrup and cottage cheese balls to the cream mixture. Cook for another 10 minutes. 
8. Garnish with chopped pistachios and almonds. 
9. Serve chilled.

recipes_list.name: Mishti Doi (Sweet yogurt)
recipes_list.cooking_method:
1. Boil the milk in a heavy-bottomed pan. 
2. Add sugar and stir until dissolved. 
3. Lower the heat and simmer for 30-40 minutes until the milk reduces to half. 
4. Add cardamom powder and saffron. Mix well. 
5. Pour the mixture into earthen pots or glass bowls. 
6. Let it cool to room temperature. 
7. Cover the pots/bowls with a lid or plastic wrap. Keep in a warm place for 6-8 hours or until set. 
8. Refrigerate for a few hours. 
9. Garnish with chopped pistachios and almonds before serving.

chefs.chefDetail: Amina Khan is a talented Bangladeshi chef who loves to create unique and flavorful dishes using local ingredients. With a background in nutrition and dietetics, she believes in cooking with fresh and healthy ingredients that are good for both the body and the soul.

recipes_list.name: Chitol Macher Muitha (Fish dumplings in spicy tomato gravy)
recipes_list.cooking_method:
1. Boil the fish and chana dal in a pot of water until cooked. 
2. Drain the water and let it cool. Remove the bones and mash the fish and chana dal. 
3. Add ginger paste, garlic paste, green chillies and salt. Mix well. 
4. Shape the mixture into small balls. 
5. Heat oil in a pan. Fry the fish balls until golden brown. Remove and keep aside. 
6. In the same pan, add onion and sauté until translucent. 
7. Add cumin powder, coriander powder, turmeric powder and red chilli powder. Mix well. 
8. Add tomatoes and salt. Cook until the tomatoes are soft and mushy. 
9. Add water and bring to a boil. 
10. Add the fish balls and simmer for 10-15 minutes. 
11. Add garam masala powder and mix well. 
12. Serve hot with steamed rice.

recipes_list.name: Bhuna Khichuri (Spiced lentil and rice stew)
recipes_list.cooking_method:
1. Wash the rice and lentils and soak in water for 30 minutes. 
2. Heat ghee in a pan. Add onion and sauté until golden brown. 
3. Add ginger paste, garlic paste, green chillies and salt. Mix well. 
4. Add cumin powder, cori
